related_questions.question: Is the market closed on Memorial Day?
related_questions.title: AI Overview
list: Memorial Day is a federal holiday: . Opens in new tabThis means that government offices, including the Federal Reserve, are closed.
Stock markets are closed: . Opens in new tabThe NYSE and Nasdaq, along with other U.S. stock and bond markets, observe the holiday and are closed for trading.
Regular trading resumes on Tuesday: . Opens in new tabThe markets will reopen on Tuesday, May 27th, at their usual time, which is 9:30 a.m. ET.
Bond market specifics: . Opens in new tabThe bond market will also be closed on Memorial Day and will close early, at 2 p.m. ET, the Friday before the holiday.

related_questions.question: Are the markets open on Black Friday?
related_questions.snippet: The stock market generally follows its holiday schedule without any additional early closures, with the exception of the day before Independence Day, Black Friday and Christmas Eve, when the Nasdaq and NYSE close at 1 p.m. ET.
